channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [CXF-3047] org.apache.cxf.interceptor.Fault: Unmarshalling Error: UndeclaredPrefix: Cannot resolve 's:string' as a QName: the prefix 's' is not declared.
item.description:
see also https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CXF-2340

I've attached a sample project (stolen from CXF-2340 and modified) to show the problem.

DefaultValidationEventHandler: [FATAL_ERROR]: UndeclaredPrefix: Cannot resolve 's:string' as a QName: the prefix 's' is not declared.
Location: line 4
07.10.2010 11:45:12 org.apache.cxf.phase.PhaseInterceptorChain doDefaultLogging
WARNUNG: Interceptor for

{http://server.type_substitution.fromjava/}

SedansServicePorts#

{http://server.type_substitution.fromjava/}

GetSedansOperation has thrown exception, unwinding now

item.summary: org.apache.cxf.interceptor.Fault: Unmarshalling Error: UndeclaredPrefix: Cannot resolve 's:string' as a QName: the prefix 's' is not declared.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Found a way to hack around this. It really is a deficiency in the Stax spec and the Validator API's that makes it impossible to do correctly, but the hack should work.

I suspect that this fix is not enough.
If you un-un-comment the SAAJ and WSS4J configuration in the cxf-context.xml
you will get a new Use-Case where the source is the W3CDomStreamReader.
Reopen to make sure the new part of this is tracked.
Take W3CDOMStreamReader into account when searching for namespaces.
